question: The 2018 National Girl Child Day (NGCD) is observed on __________.
explanation: The National Girl Child Day (NGCD) is celebrated every year on January 24 with an aim to raise awareness about sex ratio levels and promote the empowerment of girls. The programme was organised by the State Resource Centre for Women in collaboration with the Nagaland State Social Welfare Board (NSSWB) and the Entrepreneur Development and Integrated Training Institute (EDITI). With the rest of the country, national Girl child day was observed and in its commemoration a workshop on skill development under the theme "A skilled generation: An independent generation- BBBP" was held at the Government Primary School, T Khel, Kohima village.
